alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 6:14PM EDT until April 12 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to developing thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from these developing thunderstorms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with the developing thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning maybe needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The- Sea, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Wilton Manors, Sea Ranch Lakes, Lazy Lake, Palm Aire, Twin Lakes, Village Park and Broadview- Pompano Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
